column5:
Link to spin.umd.js as alternative for those who can't use ES6 modules

Closes #367.

The UMD file is not included in the npm package since it's unnecessary for anyone using a module bundler.

Add a tip to check that the document has loaded (#339)

Add a tip to check that the document has loaded
Use files whitelist rather than .npmignore blacklist

Set transparent shadow by default to prevent aliased lines

Resolves #355.

Use external CSS file to support keyframe animations with strict content security policy (#347)

Added a new `animation` option to choose a CSS animation name, and removed the `opacity` and `trail` options.

IE 9 is no longer supported, so the legacy `fps` option has also been removed.
Add quotes for shadow option in usage example (#360)
Add Content-Security-Policy header during development to ensure compatibility

Add `fadeColor` option for customizing the color that lines fade to

Resolves #30.

Add support for custom box-shadow values with corrected positioning (#346)

Directly applying a box-shadow to the spinner lines would cause the shadow to be rotated along with the lines, which doesn't look natural. Previously, this was avoided by generating another element for each line, coloring it black and applying a black box-shadow, and then positioning it down a couple pixels beneath the line. However, this approach didn't allow customization of the shadow position and color, and also blocked use of inset shadows or multiple blended shadows with different positions.

This commit solves these issues by parsing a standard box-shadow value to determine its x and y offsets, and then using trigonometry to correct the shadow coordinates for each line based on its degrees of rotation.

Native CSS scaling is now used so that shadows will be scaled along with the lines as expected.

Resolves #35.

Remove invisible box shadow

Fixes #179, closes #180.
Update meta description to improve searchability (#334)
Update readme to explicitly set the target variable (#338)
Fix homepage event listeners in Internet Explorer

Merge pull request #343 from theodorejb/v3

Rewrite in TypeScript as a modern ES6 module
Document release notes on GitHub instead of index.html file

Rewrite in TypeScript as a modern ES6 module

* Replaced dynamic CSS keyframe animations with `requestAnimationFrame`
    * This adds support for Content Security Policy "style-src 'self';" option (resolves #115, resolves #229)
    * Fixes janky animation appearance in Microsoft Edge (resolves #342)
    * Fixes missing line with trail set to 100 in IE (resolves #327)
    * Animation logic is now unified in all browsers
* Library is now distributed as an ES6 module (closes #341, fixes #340)
* Removed useless `hwaccel` option
* Dropped IE 6-8 support and removed VML fallback since it isn't needed for IE 9+
* Moved internal functions out of Spinner instance
* Removed minified files from bundle
* Removed jQuery plugin (closes #325)
* Dropped bower/composer/component/spm support. Install from npm instead (recommended), or save spin.js file in your repo.
* Updated website to use native range inputs rather than polyfill, and remove jQuery usage
* Added CONTRIBUTING.md file

Version 3.0 does not change the public Spinner API, so if you are already using a module bundler such as Webpack or Rollup, upgrading should be as easy as adding the following ES6 module import:

```javascript
import {Spinner} from 'spin.js';
```
Use a more idiomatic code style and eslint to enforce it

Merge pull request #300 from mikesherov/patch-1

Update UMD Shim to be resilient to HTMLElement global pollution

Update UMD Shim to be resilient to HTMLElement global pollution

Please see https://github.com/umdjs/umd/pull/63/files and https://github.com/umdjs/umd/issues/35 for more information, but
this change prevents an HTML element with an id of `module` from cuasing the UMD shim to incorrectly detect the enivornment as node.

  Workaround for negative margin bug in IE. Fixes #27

Workaround for negative margin bug in IE. Fixes #27
Calling spin() now auto-stops the previous copy. Closes #28
The new operator is now optional. Closes #14
Adjusting the sliders now modifies the example code
The frame-rate for the javascript animation fallback is now configurable.
Calculate exact border-radius. Fixes a bug with older WebKits that otherwise ignore the setting.
Instead of trying all prefixes, extract it from `useCssAnimations`

Use a different animation for each line instead of
animation-delay. Fixes #12.

Load fd-slider first and wait until it has 
converted the input fields (which happens on load)
before registering the change listeners.

Kick off the animation by setting a CSS class.
This greatly improves the situation mentioned in
issue #12 and might also help with #20.

Optimized the script for gzip compression. While
the minified version is now slightly larger, the
raw code is much more readable and the gzipped
version is even smaller than before.
Updated jQuery plugin to remove data. Fixes #24
Added Android 2.3 to the compatibility list
Test if Spinner.el is defined. Fixes #22
Moved the example up, right behind the downloads.
Don't re-use DOM elements (fixes #19). Also clear pending timeouts for the case that spin() is called immediately after stop().
The demo now uses the minified version.
Use getElementsByTagName() to look up head. Fixes #13
Updated the jQuery plugin to use the color set via CSS. See #10
Temporarily switched off one of the spinners and the shadow for performance tests.
